title: What did Fleabag's Phoebe Waller-Bridge say about Love Island on SNL?
text:
Carrying on her ascent to super-stardom, Waller-Bridge hosted SNL for the first time (Picture: Rex Features)

It’s been quite the year for Phoebe Waller-Bridge.

Emmys galore, a sell-out run of shows on the West End and now her debut as a hot on the iconic Saturday Night Live (SNL).

Considering she has her finger on the pulse of British life in 2019, it’s no surprise her hosting gig had a little nod to Love Island…

What did Phoebe Waller-Bridge say about Love Island?

She didn’t say anything, as it were, but she took part in a merciless parody skit – that honestly could’ve been a word-for-word recreation of a real Love Island episode.

In the sketch, West London’s Waller-Bridge looking donned a black wig, prosthetic nose and orange tan.

‘Just got my lips done – I asked the doctor for an allergic reaction’, she said, imitating her very best Essex accent.

She’ll be hoping for a text from Hot Priest (Picture: BACKGRID)

After being ghosted by her Love Island suitor, Waller-Bridge threw it back to one of Love Island’s best-known phrases and cried: ‘The whole thing’s a bit muggy.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Things turned around on the island though.

After realising she has 1.2 million Instagram followers, the character says: ‘Well I don’t have to be a stupid paediatric nurse anymore do I? Kerching.’

Fleabag, is that you? (Picture: BACKGRID)

What else happened on Phoebe Waller-Bridge’s SNL?

She opened the show with a witty monologue explaining the differences between her and her Fleabag character.

Though both character and real-life Phoebe are ‘sexually depraved, foul-mouthed and dangerous’ (her words!), she added ‘I’m not a sex addict because I wrote Fleabag – but I did write Killing Eve because I’m a psychopath.’

She also, unsurprisingly for anyone who’s seen Fleabag, took a stand for women being as bawdy, brazen and bossy as they please.

Referring back to her recent Emmy triumphs, she said: ‘Back in the day, horny women were to be feared. And now they’re given Emmys.’

Phoebe and Taylor joined forces for SNL (Picture: Twitter)

How many Emmys did Phoebe Waller-Bridge win?

She took home the Emmy for Lead Actress in a Comedy Series and Writing for a Comedy Series, with Fleabag taking home the gold for Outstanding Comedy Series over long-running favourites like Veep.

Phoebe Waller Bridge taking SNL by storm is just another accomplishment in what’s been a very fruitful few years.

From Fleabag’s huge success on home turf and overseas, to Killing Eve’s massive plaudits and being tipped to write the next Bond, the Ealing native is conquering the world.

MORE: Fleabag’s Phoebe Waller-Bridge scores ‘$20million-a-year’ Amazon deal after Emmy success

MORE: Fleabag’s Phoebe Waller-Bridge has saved 2019 with this one picture
description: Phoebe Waller-Bridge, fresh from her Emmys success, hosted Saturday Night Live for the first time. What did she say about Love Island?
